message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $14,000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident it will be worth more than that to you. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $11,000. I'm confident we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, but $11,000 is simply too low for me.  I'm willing to come down a bit further, but I need to get at least $13,000 for this product.  Let's find a middle ground.
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $13,000, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $12,500?

Bob, I understand your budget is tight, but I can't go any lower than $13,000. It's still a good deal for you, and I'm confident you'll find the product to be more than worth it. Let's make this happen.
I really like the product, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $12,500? I'm confident we can make a deal that works for both of us.

Bob, I'm starting to feel like we're going in circles. I've already come down from my initial offer, and I can't go any lower than $13,000.  This product is worth a lot more, and I'm sure you'll agree once you see its value.  If you're not serious about closing this deal, I'll need to move on to other buyers.
I understand you're eager to move on to other buyers, but I'm still interested in making a deal. I'm willing to meet you at $12,250. This is my final offer, and I hope we can close the deal.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $13,000. You've seen the value of this product, and I know you'll be happy with it at that price. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to go with another buyer. This is my final offer.
